snippet: Despite concerns about Pfc. Bradley Manning’s mental health, a former supervisor testified that he let him keep working because of understaffing and the private’s role in analyzing threats.
abstract: Former supervisor of Pfc Bradley Manning testifies at his court-martial trial that Army intelligence unit in Iraq allowed Manning to keep working with classified information despite recurring concerns about his mental health because unit was understaffed and he was playing vital role in analyzing insurgent threats.
lead_paragraph: Despite concerns about Pfc. Bradley Manning’s mental health, a former supervisor testified that he let him keep working because of understaffing and the private’s role in analyzing threats.

headline.main: Manning Played Vital Role in Iraq Despite Erratic Behavior, Supervisor Says
headline.print_headline: Manning Played Vital Role in Iraq Despite Erratic Behavior, Supervisor Says

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
